Remark |- |- | 1 || Benaulim || Mickky Pacheco | bgcolor="" | | Nationalist Congress Party || | Due to resignation of Mickky Pacheco |- | 2 || Margao || Digambar Kamat | bgcolor="" | | Indian National Congress || | Due to resignation of Digambar Kamat |- | 3 || Poinguinim || Isidore Fernandes | bgcolor="" | | Indian National Congress || | Due to resignation of Isidore Fernandes |- | 4 || Poinguinim || Ramesh Tawadkar | bgcolor="" | | Bharatiya Janata Party || | Due to resignation of Isidore Fernandes |- | 5 || Taleigao || Babush Monserrate | bgcolor="" | | Indian National Congress || | Due to resignation of Babush Monserrate |- |} == Government formation == On 3 June 2002, Bharatiya Janata Party formed its first government in Goa under the leadership of Manohar Parrikar which lasted for 2 years and 244 days. government fall due to Digambar Kamat fallout Bharatiya Janata Party ==References== Category:State Assembly elections in Goa Category:2000s in Goa Category:2002 State Assembly elections in India
